targets.expr: sum by(job) (irate(cpu_usage{job=~"$host", state!="idle"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(job) sum by(job) (irate(cpu_usage{job=~"$host", state=~".+"}[$__rate_interval]))
sum by(job) (irate(cpu_usage{job=~"$host", state="system"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(job) sum by(job) (irate(cpu_usage{job=~"$host", state=~".+"}[$__rate_interval]))
sum by(job) (irate(cpu_usage{job=~"$host", state="user"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(job) sum by(job) (irate(cpu_usage{job=~"$host", state=~".+"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.description: Number of cores Rezolus is using, executing in system-mode
panels.title: System Cores

panels.description: Number of cores Rezolus is using, in user-mode
panels.title: User Cores

panels.description: Distribution of approximate block IO sizes (for all block IOs)
panels.title: BlockIO Size

panels.description: The delay from a packet being ready until it is read by the userspace application
panels.title: TCP Packet Latency

panels.description: Distribution of the time tasks spent runnable, but waiting in the runqueue
panels.title: Runqueue Latency

panels.description: Distribution of the amount of time that tasks spent running on-cpu
panels.title: Running

panels.description: Per-core CPU usage in system time, visualized as a heatmap

targets.expr: sum by(id) (irate(cpu_usage{job=~"$host", state="system"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by(id) (irate(cpu_usage{job=~"$host", state=~".+"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: System

targets.expr: avg by(id) (irate(cpu_usage{job=~"$host", state="user"}[$__rate_interval])) / sum by(id) (irate(cpu_usage{job=~"$host", state=~".+"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.description: Instructions per kilocycle per-CPU, visualized as a heatmap
panels.title: IPKC
